categories.description: Testez vos connaissances sur Angular et son écosystème.
Quiz sur les concepts clés de React et son fonctionnement.
Questions sur le framework progressif Vue.js.

questions.questionLabel: What is a component in Angular?
Explain the purpose of the NgModule in Angular.
How do you create a new Angular application?
What is data binding in Angular, and what are the different types of data binding?
Explain the difference between {{}} (interpolation) and [property] (property binding) in Angular templates.
What is React?
What is JSX in React?
What is the difference between a class component and a functional component in React?
What are React Hooks and why are they used?
What is the purpose of useState in React?
What is the Virtual DOM in React and how does it work?
What is the purpose of useEffect in React?
What is React Router and what is it used for?
Explain the concept of props in React.
What is state lifting in React?
What is Vue.js?
What is the Vue instance?
What are directives in Vue.js? Give examples.
What is the purpose of computed properties in Vue.js?
Explain the concept of components in Vue.js.
What is Vuex and when would you use it?

What is the Vue Router used for?
What is a mixin in Vue.js?

answers.answerLabel: A reusable building block for the user interface
A style in Angular
NgModule is used to declare and configure modules in Angular applications.
NgModule is a component in Angular.
A JavaScript library for building user interfaces
A backend framework
A database tool
A syntax extension that allows writing HTML inside JavaScript
A templating engine
Functional components are simpler and use hooks instead of lifecycle methods.
Hooks are functions that let you use React features without writing a class.
useState allows adding local state to functional components.
The Virtual DOM is an in-memory representation of the real DOM used for efficient updates.
useEffect performs side effects like data fetching or DOM updates after render.
React Router manages navigation between different views or pages in a React app.
Props are inputs passed to components to make them reusable.
State lifting means moving shared state to a common ancestor component.
A progressive JavaScript framework for building user interfaces.
The root object that controls the Vue app and links data to the DOM.
Directives are special tokens in the markup that tell Vue to do something to a DOM element (e.g., v-if, v-for).
Computed properties are cached values that depend on reactive data.
Components are reusable Vue instances with a name and template.
Vuex is a state management library for Vue applications.
v-if removes elements from the DOM, while v-show only hides them with CSS.
Vue Router is used for navigating between components or views.
Mixins allow reusable chunks of logic to be shared between components.
By running 'vue create project-name' using the Vue CLI.
